critique: The document outlines rules and regulations for budget preparation and submission, emphasizing the role of the Bureau of the Budget in revising and adjusting estimates from various departments. It highlights the Director's authority in determining the content and arrangement of estimates, subject to Presidential review. The document also mentions considerations for reducing working forces, compensation, and eliminating unnecessary activities. It touches upon the importance of providing the President with information for forming business policy through consolidated statements of estimated revenue and expenditure.
